intro: Brachystephanus jaundensis var. brevitubus, commonly known as the short-tubed jaunded stephanus, is a rare and enigmatic plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and unique tubular structures that resemble small, elongated leaves. The plant exhibits a striking yellowish-green coloration, which is most prominent during its flowering period. Its botanical features include small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring, followed by the development of distinctive, tubular fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern.
